intro: Adonis microcarpa var. cretica, commonly known as the Cretan Adonis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, early spring blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its flowers are usually bright yellow and are followed by distinctive, woolly seed heads. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
